messageBody:
On Wednesday 21 July 2004 08:25 am, Kevin O'Sullivan wrote:
> Hi -
>
> I am modifying code in an existing app. I have changed code a private
> method, and I'm trying to write a junit test case (the first on this proj)
> to validate this. (see pseudo code below)
>
> The problem is with the call to the static class ServiceLocator to get the
> 'client' object. Normally I would just mock this to client obj to do
> nothing, as I don't care a jot about it in my test case. (I need to mock
> it because it makes calls to a web service). Because its instantiated
> inside the method, I can't see any simple way to mock the client object.
>
> Due to the overall architecture of the app, it is not possible to chng
> myPublicMethod() pass  in client or ServiceLocator.  I'm thinking of these
> options:

I had the same situation in my current project. I use the Web Service purely
on a client basis. So, what I did was wrap the access to the ServiceLocator
which uses a property to instantiate the proper object. Beyond that, I have
a "copy" of the Axis generated ServiceLocator that points to a mock service.
During tests this is the mock is the one that is instantiated. In production
it defaults to the original locator.
